page.title: 01Hamstreet and Ruckinge
page.content: Hamstreet is situated on the northern edge of Romney marsh at the crossroads of the main A2070 (Ashford/Lydd) and the minor B2067 on which, 3 Km east stands Ruckinge. Romney marsh intensively cultivated pasture predominantly for sheep, cereals, rape and root crops is intersected by drainage ditches known as sewers and dykes. Along its northern edge runs the Military Canal. Beyond it to the North the land rises about 50 metres as an escarpment, then continues level covered with sparse deciduous woodland alternting with intensively farmed crops and pasture. Hamstreet encompasses, besides the development along the Street, five housing estates (two council/three privte). Of the lost village of Orleston formerly situated around the Parish Church on top of the escarpment only the Manor
